definitions.definition: A place or building , consisting of a stage and seating, in which an audience gathers to watch plays , musical performances, public ceremonies, and so on.
A region where a particular action takes place; a specific field of action, usually with reference to war.
examples: His grandfather was in the Pacific theater during the war.

definitions.definition: An operating theatre or locale for human experimentation.
examples: This man is about to die, get him into theater at once!
We sat in the back row of the theater and threw popcorn at the screen.

definitions.definition: Drama or performance as a profession or art form.
examples: I worked in theater for twenty-five years.

definitions.definition: Any place rising by steps like the seats of a theater.
A conspicuous but unproductive display of action.
labels: often following a noun used attributively
definitions.label_groups: figurative , derogatory , often following a noun used attributively

main_definition: ( countable ) A place or building , consisting of a stage and seating, in which an audience gathers to watch plays , musical performances, public ceremonies, and so on.
secondary_definitions: A region where a particular action takes place; a specific field of action, usually with reference to war.
( medicine ) An operating theatre or locale for human experimentation.
Drama or performance as a profession or art form.
Any place rising by steps like the seats of a theater.
( figurative , derogatory , often following a noun used attributively ) A conspicuous but unproductive display of action.
